lines.text: Enter, severally, DUKE VINCENTIO disguised as a friar, and Provost

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: Hail to you, provost! so I think you are.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: I am the provost. Whats your will, good friar

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: Bound by my charity and my blest order, I come to visit the afflicted spirits Here in the prison. Do me the common right To let me see them and to make me know The nature of their crimes, that I may minister To them accordingly.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: I would do more than that, if more were needful. Look, here comes one: a gentlewoman of mine, Who, falling in the flaws of her own youth, Hath blisterd her report: she is with child And he that got it, sentenced a young man More fit to do another such offence Than die for this.
Enter JULIET

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: When must he die

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: As I do think, tomorrow. I have provided for you: stay awhile, And you shall be conducted.
To JULIET

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: Repent you, fair one, of the sin you carry

lines.speaker: juliet
lines.text: I do and bear the shame most patiently.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: Ill teach you how you shall arraign your conscience, And try your penitence, if it be sound, Or hollowly put on.

lines.speaker: juliet
lines.text: Ill gladly learn.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: Love you the man that wrongd you

lines.speaker: juliet
lines.text: Yes, as I love the woman that wrongd him.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: So then it seems your most offenceful act Was mutually committed

lines.speaker: juliet
lines.text: Mutually.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: Then was your sin of heavier kind than his.

lines.speaker: juliet
lines.text: I do confess it, and repent it, father.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: Tis meet so, daughter: but lest you do repent, As that the sin hath brought you to this shame, Which sorrow is always towards ourselves, not heaven, Showing we would not spare heaven as we love it, But as we stand in fear,

lines.speaker: juliet
lines.text: I do repent me, as it is an evil, And take the shame with joy.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: There rest. Your partner, as I hear, must die tomorrow, And I am going with instruction to him. Grace go with you, Benedicite!
Exit

lines.speaker: juliet
lines.text: Must die tomorrow! O injurious love, That respites me a life, whose very comfort Is still a dying horror!

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: Tis pity of him.
Exeunt
